one_reviews_text:
This was a great experience for the price.

The graphics are close enough to photorealistic that it's possible to forget you're in VR. The game makes good use of real photos and videos (on laptops, TV screens, projectors) to make you feel like you're in the real world, and even the in-game humans(?) you meet are fairly convincing.

Not a ton of interaction beyond opening doors and picking up items, but what's there is very intuitive and works as you'd expect it to work in reality, with an attention to detail you don't often get in video games, VR or otherwise.

It also incorporates a good deal of real-world folklore, which helps to make even the supernatural elements feel that much more real.

And yes, it is scary. The game expertly ramps up the suspense, and got two good screams out of me during the short playtime from beginning to end.

If you are new in the VR world I do recommend you to buy this game since it is short but it has everything, you do have to interact with the enviroment for you to continue with the history. 
It is perfect for you to show it to someone who has never experienced VR terror games also it is amazing even for people like me who has tried other terror games, I simply loved it!
Keep it up with the good god guys, I'll be looking forward for chapter 2.
Cannot beat this for the price. Only issue I have is getting stuck to walls or ledges occasionally.

I like horror movies. But in VR, horror is too much for me. Games like Paranormal Activity or Don't knock twice nearly killed me.
But Kobold is exactly the perfect amount of horror for me. There was only one major jump scare .The rest is just giving you the creeps in a great looking and sounding atmosphere. I hope, there will be a 2nd part.

I highly recommend watching the 15 min film on the website, well done.
I'm glad I watched the film before playing.

Great game, and would recommend it.

For as cheap as it is I really recommend it. We had about 20 people over and one person played it while the rest watched it being projected on our theater system with surround sound. After about an hour we reached the pinnacle of the story (and subsequently the end) and everyone was screaming-- it was certainly a memorable VR moment!

Conclusion: I hope they continue the story.

Graphics: 3.5/5
Sound: 4/5
Story: 4/5
Fear Factor: 4/5

Other
Interactive Environment: 2/5
Controls: 3/5
Bugs: (none noticed)

review_title: Not for the faint of heart.
one_reviews_text: Ohhh the atmosphere is thick in the this one.. Very immersive and easily the scariest game I have ever played in VR hands down. If you like horror, do not miss this one!

After playing the first chapter again and spending a lot more time, I was able to see the incredible amount of small details that I had not noticed before. After commenting on what I thought of Episode 1 in which I didn't spend much time or pay attention to detail, the AnotherWorld team got in touch with me and we very kindly and cordially discussed various points in the game.

A great chapter, waiting for the second with great desire. They are working on it and with a lot of effort. It is a highly recommended purchase and is very enjoyable. The atmosphere is very well done and the experience at Kobold is equally rewarding and terrifying.

I recommend your purchase and patience for this great team.
I boght the game 3 days ago and still can not turn the game so i want my money back.
review_feedback: Hey, can you please write an e-mail to support@anotherworldvr.com and describe what you mean with not working?

one_reviews_text:
I really enjoyed this experience. It was spooky the whole way though. The story was good. Graphics were excellent. There was one scare in particular that got me pretty good. Short but well worth the price.
I played on the rift s. I had a small issue about half way through where one of my controllers started vibrating like crazy. I don't know if it was the game or just something random. After restarting the game it was fine and didn't take long to get back to where I left off.
Some cool ideas, poorly executed.. its really cheap so i give them that.. but its to short and unpolished to recomend..
really liked the game wish there was a second part

Hey what can you expect from a 5 dollar game. The graphics were amazing! i waiting for the next part of this game to buy it. It was around 30 min gameplay. but it had a rich story line that kept me playing.
No German ...

When I bought the game I had some issues and I reported it, and immediately they helped me to repair all the issues, they also gave me a game for free! They are really fast to help you when you have any problems or issues. Thank you for helping me Team Kobold :) . The game is very scary and entertaining, it is a fantastic experience!
review_feedback: Thank you for letting us know that it works for you now.

one_reviews_text:
As my first time playing a horror title in vr this had me wanting to back out the whole way through. I toughed it out and I'm glad I did because despite the game being a bit short(1hr~) I thoroughly enjoyed it. 

Overall I'd say for the sale price I bought it at it's a solid worthwhile experience, but if it were fullprice I'd suggest waiting for a sale

I have had an issue with my oculus rift and I couldnt play the game, therefore I managed to fix it and I can say the game is very interesting and involving. The atmosphere and gameplay is really good! Worth the money!
review_feedback: Cool! Glad to hear you got your Rift working again and enjoyed KOBOLD!

one_reviews_text: so yeah  it looks good and all that, probably got 1/4 of the way to giving me a jump scare too BUT i read a comment below stating that somebody took an hour and a half to find the boy but i  THINK i did it   in 26 mins (i was certainly not rushing through) was the forest part the end? i'm unsure now as to whether i've failed and need to restart or  if it   was just that short

I thought the game was great, playing on the Rift S. While the graphics are fine, it's more than made up for by the chilling atmosphere and interesting story. While navigating the mansion is spooky enough, feeling somewhat like a horror-themed escape room, the game ends just as it's getting good. Without spoiling much, the ending sequence felt very "Blair Witch" to me, which I loved. However, just after this sequence, the game ends (in a very startling way, I may add) and you're hit with the rolling credits. Interacting with the world is fairly intuitive, and there is plenty to interact with. Whether it's reading note, operating a VCR, slide projector, or locating keys and drawings symbols with chalk. The inventory system is easy to work with and pleasing to the eye, but I didn't find myself using it as much as I thought I would. 

All in all a great experience that might require a little over an hour of your time, but it will certainly be an exciting and interesting hour. Here's hoping for a second episode.
Awsome gmae it aws rgeat sevn out orf fiv satrs

really well realized game that istantly sucks you in. It's full of details that makes you truly feel yourself in a real situation. Vr is really well exploited here.
old VHS videos, diapositives and old age audio cassettes to listen, together with the well acted voice that reads letters, create  a really great atmosphere.
Too bad is so short! But the experience is coherent with the price, epsecially if it's on sale!

looking for the next chapter

review_title: so much potential but i have problems
one_reviews_text: Although i want so badly to play the game coz the graphics are great i have critical problems playing the game. I have huge drop frames when iam walking out the first door and go to the yard. Then i got stucked and couldnt move in the first stairs but when i moved once and managed to open the mansions door i got stucked as there aswell... I reinstalled 2 times .The third time i installed it on the SSD drive as it is recommened..I am playing with the Oculus Link BTW ....Also i dont think my PC is the problem . Coz it is a i7 9700 with an RTX 2060 6GB...and 16 RAM . I hope for an answer coz i want so badly to play and give the 5 stars it deserves ! Cheers from Greece      update... I lowered the graphics and it worked but I can't believe that an i7 9700 and rtx 2060 6gb is not enough to run at full. The game was interesting though with vsome very nice moments, so a 4 stars for me :)
review_feedback:
Hey there,
Glad to hear you are trying out playing KOBOLD on the Quest via cable! Please remember that this still experimental until the official link cable is released. In the first room (before entering the green door) there is a menu on the wall where you can lower your graphics settings. Use the remote control on the table and point it at the menu where it says graphics normal and high settings. The game is set to high by default. Point the white circle cursor over the lower graphics setting and it will change. We recommend this setting for Oculus Quest via link cable.

one_reviews_text: My first experience with this: I was blown away by the realism. By the time the first scare hit me I was so deeply gone in the world that I forgot where I was completely. It took me about an hour and half to find the boy. The ending was a  good cliffhanger.  Loved the whole world and interacting with all the old stuff lying and I especially loved drawing with the chalk.  Graphics are next level. Atmosphere is spooky.  It felt very very real. Im playing this again at my Halloween party for sure!

thanks for responding and it's working perfectly now,you were correct,all I had to do was go into the user folder and erase the settings config...I have a previous version on Steam also,so the config settings were probably conflicting etc the game to me was just that good that I purchased it twice, once on steam and just recently on oculus...too bad I'm too cowardly to finish the experience...works and plays perfectly though👍🏽and oh yeah,sorry for leaving a bad review before by acting like a spoiled brat,was having a bad day
review_feedback:
We looked into this and found out that in very rare cases this can happen if you launch KOBOLD via Steam VR beforehand and then open it in your Oculus Store library afterwards. It causes a conflict between Steam VR controller bindings and Oculus inputs.There is a workaround if you delete the config file at this path: Windows (C:) Users \YourUsername\AppData\Local\Kobold_EA\Saved
If you delete this config file, or the entire saved folder your inputs should work again the next time you start the game. Don't worry, the config file will write itself anew when you start the game. The cause of this is an incompatibility between Steam VR and Oculus and we are working with them to fix it. If your problem persists, please write to support(at)anotherworldvr.com Don't be rude. We are here to help. Thanks.

one_reviews_text:
guess it may be a great experience, but i can not interact with menu at all.  in teracting with objects is unintuative.  took me 20 minutes just to walk out first door, then, nothing, all black, flashlight just disappeared.

you sit and try to do what seems natural, but you are left wondering ....WTF??  this is NOT VR!!  this is guess and what your contoller can NOT do.

gave 2 stars becuase i figure,  IF .... they figure out how to include rift-s controls, i could be a good experience.
review_feedback: Hi. Rift S controls are supported. To interact with the menu pick up the remote on the table (it is blinking) using either your index trigger or grip button on your controller and then point the remote at the menu. A white cursor will appear. Hover the cursor over the menu item you would like to change and it will change. Your flashlight did not disappear, chances are you placed it in your bag at your hip. The bag is your inventory system. Look down and you should find the flashlight there. This is a standing experience. Chances are you are having issues because you are sitting down. If you are new to standing, room scale VR with interactive controllers that's OK. just reach out to us at support@anotherworldvr.com if you have any other problems. Thanks.

one_reviews_text: Like many VR experiences, this was pretty short. It almost felt more like a demo, but there's definitely some meat to this story that I look forward to chewing on in forthcoming chapters. I wrapped up with this in just under an hour, but it was definitely an unsettling hour. I was scared for pretty much the entire time, and genuinely terrified at a couple of choice moments. Overall it was a fun, if not slightly underwhelming experience and I'm happy to have purchased it. Hopefully this was the first installment of many, because this is an excellent example of how horror games can offer you scares on a whole new level that flat games could never touch. I really enjoyed this. Keep up the great work, devs.
Very creepy.  Looking forward to chapter 2!

I initially had an issue with loading the game - it would take me to a black screen then would ultimately crash. The issue somehow resolved it's self after several attempts to fix it. Not sure what the true fix was. With that said, I've played part of the game and it's very scary. The visuals are top notch as well. 

Updated to give the game a more suitable score.

RTX 2080, Intel i7 4790k
review_feedback: Thanks for updating your review. If you should encounter any more problems feel free to send an email to support@anotherworldvr.com

one_reviews_text: spooky and super realistic movie quality.

UPDATE: Was given instructions from the developer on how to fix the controller problem with the Rift S.  Game works great now.

ORIGINAL REVIEW: Controls for the Rift S do not work.
review_feedback: Glad to hear this worked. If anyone else experiences this issue please write to support@anotherworldvr.com and we will help you fix it quickly.

one_reviews_text: this game is scary af
One of those few times I forgot I was in a game and just believed everything happening around me.
Very scary... cant wait to see what they do next.
One of the scariest experiences I have had in VR

I don't know if they are planning on doing a part 2 of this game or not, but to me it felt more like a "walking simulator" than a game. I started to get really into it, collecting all I could and reading everything and all. But despite doing that, I was very negatively surprised when I reached the end after one hour of play.

Fortunately, I got it on sale so not really feel like I was scammed or anything. Don't take me wrong, that hour of gaming was awesome, and the ending was like the things I always feared too (so bonus point to manage to scare me, when I am known to be hard to scare). 

So yeah, if it's cheap get it and have an hour of fun, but don't expect a epic long horror game though.

review_title: Heart rate went up big time!
one_reviews_text: A little short but OMG so scary and immersive!

This game has been build from the ground up for VR! you can really see this in the detail provided. Graphics are amazing, atmosphere is great also! it is very short, but if you buy it on sale (usally goes for -50% from time to time) you will get some good bang for your buck in terms of experiance, more so if you spend the extra time to read the notes, watch the videos and interact some more!

I am very eager for Chapter 2 when that comes out!

Very well done Horror experience that will have you filled with dread and anticipation as you explore the house. As others have noted, it is a bit short but it is also not premium priced and is intended to be "episodic". There are a few jump scares but this relies more on atmospheric tension, a feeling of dread and a well done excellent "creepy" atmosphere. Graphics are top quality, voice acting is good and the use of well-timed sound effects really add to the immersion. To the devs, thank you for implementing "full locomotion" and a smooth turning option. I hate teleportation and snap turning as it really ruins the immersion for me and playing this with full locomotion and smooth turning really helps with immersion.
review_feedback: Thank you for the support!

one_reviews_text:
Scared the living daylights out of me!!  Really  fun to play, especially at this time of year. 
Very immersive! The  lore is cool, the visuals are lush, the locomotion is good and does not make
you motion sick. Interactions were intuitive and practical and everything ran very well even when
set to high graphics. Thumbs up! Reviewed on Rift S /  GTX 1070

Pro:
Very immersive, with stunning graphics.
You must discover the story using all the pictures and letters and solve the puzzles (which is not too hard)
Con:
The story is too short, its more like a teaser for a upcoming release
Theres no possibility to save at a certain point
Even the story location is in Germany, theres no german language available.

Waiting for the next chapter ......

review_title: Very good but too short, we need more !!
one_reviews_text:
Hello devs, you have the perfect interface to make the best horror game. 
I rate 5 stars with a longer story.
Good job.
well done horror experience. one hour to complete so wait for it to go on sale. for $3 it is worthy. For $9 it is not

This one really got me. I screamed like a sissy and now I'm hooked and can't wait for more. You get a really good horror experience for the price and a midnight trip to East Germany. It's authentic and stunning. Take your time with it and fear not the dark itself, but what may lurk within it...

Ok. It'a a decent game with good graphics and nice atmosphere...
But...only 20 minutes??? Seriously??? 10 euros for 20-25 minutes of gameplay?
Unacceptable. At least, when more chapters are released, include them in the same price

- good first impression but really dissapointing
- too short and too expensive for it's length
- runs like molasses, a VR Developer should really focus on best performance, looks are secondary
But sound is very atmospheric and well done.
review_feedback: If it didn't run well on your system did you try setting the graphics to low in the main menu?

one_reviews_text: Got a different ending depending on which way I went.  Second time around I found more stuff in the house I hadn't seen before. There's one particular hidden spot that scared the bejesus out of me. If you play it you'll know exactly what I mean when you find it. Good title with nice visual, lights sound and excellent investigative storytelling.

Very creepy game, but when mirroring for others to watch, everything is cropped and pushed in. One reviewer mentioned this here in his review in April and devs responded it would roll back the version to fix this. Was this done, devs? Want to keep this game, but need to see a response before deciding to keep or get a refund within the next 12 days. Thanks.
review_feedback: This has now been fixed. Please update to the latest version.

one_reviews_text:
This is great on Rift S!  I tend to be picky with horror games.
This one is great I can't believe I haven't heard of it before.
It easily beats a lot of other so called "horror experiences"
where I didn't even flinch. in Kobold VR I flinched and even
screamed a few times.

I like horror games when they have a good story and are immersive. This one is pretty good. Graphics are good except for some 2D picture implementation of objects. Story unfolds as you make your way through and discover details about the  missing. family.  This game took me about 30 minutes and I will play it again and take a few different paths. The tension builds and the end of the game is reminicent of the TV show Stranger things.  Looking foreward for chapter 2. Its a short game so get it on sale. I would not have paid full price for this game.  I am still on my quest to find the most terrifying game that will make me cry and scream and flail my arms as I run from the headset ripping the cord out of the PC. This one only has a couple jump scares but its a nice creepy story.  Short games have there advantage. You can watch others play through and you can accomplish in one play through and then go off to work to toil away and trade your precious life energy for little green pieces of paper which can then be exchanged for more VR games :)
**TO DEVS** please get rid of the virtual remote at the begining so we can simply choose game settings also the gear bag tends to flop in front of the character and gets in the way and is a little distracting at times.
review_feedback: The bag has been updated. Thanks.

one_reviews_text: Thanks! Hadn't seen this one before. It was really scary and a lot of fun in the Rift S!
the game last 15min I regret that I payed for that demo.
review_feedback: Shame you feel that way. Most players don't blast through in 15 minutes. There's a lot to miss if you do that including a hidden level.

one_reviews_text: You will need balls with their own gravitational field for this one.

Atmosphere 10/10
Graphic 10/10

Very fun game with great atmosphere that had several really good scares yet does not assault you with cheap jump scares (unless you start getting curious... in which case the game "rewards" you in a few places with jump scares.) Instead of some of the cheap tricks you find in other VR horror games this one lives off of atmosphere, storytelling and exploration. Playing it alone in your room will send shivers down your spine. Playing it with friends and watching them go through it is the best kind of schadenfreude you can have. Money well spent :-)

There is a short film that precedes the VR experience:
https://vimeo.com/300384362
I thought it was nice to watch before going into VR because it takes place in the same house that you go into. But its also no problem to just jump right into the experience.
POOR
review_feedback: The game should load. Please describe your issue in an email to support@anotherworldvr.com

one_reviews_text: looks awsome, nice details. it really was great experience, good job, congrats to the team.
Totally worth it. A fun 45 minute ride. totally spooky. super realistic - scared the potatoes out of me

Especially if you like breaking and entering old creepy houses and letting fate take care of the rest.
Graphics are beautiful. Gameplay is easy to master. Audio is very good. No bugs.
Extremely short (40-45 mins max?), but extremely creapy too.  Worth buying when on sale.
Since the update I am unable to mirror the game--the display is either cropped or the other people watching me play cannot see what I am looking at.
review_feedback: This has now been fixed. Please update to the latest version.

one_reviews_text:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=a8jKkFeXX0c (Please Note: Links might not work from Oculus so please search YouTube for 'Paradise Decay VR Kobold')

My Quick Thoughts:
Everything you expect from a VR horror is done very well here and the atmosphere build up is so good. I got goose bumps long before the horror and scares start.
I say that with no hint of irony, as the house is dark and apparently I didn't charge the batteries to my flashlight. I loved every minute of this!

review_title: Totally worth it! Fantastic and Freaky!
one_reviews_text:
I would say this is the best and most cinematic horror experience I have played on the Rift.
Totally worth it, even at full price. 
It's amazing to see how far VR has come in the last year or two. I would not have expected
to see story, atmosphere graphics and interactions like this during the DK2 times. 
What's less amazing to see is how quickly people have become spoiled by increasing
quality and complain now about the smallest details. Seriously just enjoy it and be grateful
that stuff like this is being made.
This is underrated.  I stumbled on Kobold by chance but it should be at the top of the horror section imho.

Beats Paranormal Activity in my book.
What an awesome experience. 
Spoiler Alert:
Those THINGS in the forest. OMG!
And in the house... make sure you take your time to look at everything.
Very cool. Definitely get this if you're into horror.

I absolutely loved this! It doesn't rely on cheap jump scares
The atmosphere and the story are what make it great. 
Puzzles are not too hard to solve. Everything is perfectly balanced.
You guys really know how to make a horror experience. I loved it thanks!
review_feedback: Thank you!

one_reviews_text:

Short and no much to do. 
But game is OK. 
Good graphics and sound.

review_title: Worth it to take your time
one_reviews_text: Picking up objects works fine, but the little bag have a way of getting infront of you and be in the way a little. Anyway, a good story and if you walk everywhere and look into mirrors and gaps between boards and such you might see something.
review_feedback: The picking up of objects and the bag have been adjusted. Please update to the latest version.

one_reviews_text:
While I found KOBOLD VR a bit short, I also discovered that it has several possible endings and I liked that a LOT.
Very good atmosphere, very good sound (creepy asf)
Amazing story = O That's the strong part of this game / experience.
It allows a small amount of interactivity, letting us explore in a detective way.
If you want to see a gameplay with 2 finals I leave the link to my video. As it happens the links are not selectable, copy and paste or search in youtube / freevr, thats my channel.
https://youtu.be/xZ3vFZe5Jio

The controls are very awkward and inconsistent. When you pick up an object, it is stuck in your hand until you press the trigger with your index finger, and random buttons seem to cause you to do various things with them. When I picked up a remote control in the game, squeezing the grip caused the character to press a button on it with his thumb. The options menu is inside the game, and you are supposed to use said remote to operate it, but they don't tell you how and none of the buttons or seem to actually do anything meaningful. A fairly long winded tutorial tells you basically nothing beyond explaining what a joystick is and the backwards grabbing controls. 

Just let us pick up objects by holding the grip, and drop them by releasing it, like every other game. If you are going to require button presses to interact with things, either make them naturally match the physical buttons or add some UI showing what they do. The first minutes of the game are just frustrated fumbling because nothing works the way you expect.

I feel like this game has really small issues but is a great direction forward for VR! I hate the head bobbing feature they have (This should at least be defaulted off) Also hate the interaction with light switches and buttons (Should just be able to stick my finger out and push) But other than that its excellent for how short it is. The graphics are amazing to me, love the light sourcing and was terrified when playing. Love how the narrative plays out, and I do want more but I hate this short chapter method (Although understandable because of cost) This honestly makes me want to experience this type of mixed narrative game with a full pledge 2 hour movie (I would pay for that) I would pay 15 dollars for that and would return for more.
review_feedback:
Dear jay4405,
Thanks for your feedback! There is indeed a short film that accompanies the experience and serves as its backstory. We will upload it in the next couple of weeks on the KOBOLD website and this will be free to watch. Greets, AnotherWorld VR team

one_reviews_text:
Incredible visuals and very immersive. However disappointed by the lack of free turning. Why is this not an option in a brand new high quality experience like this? Real gamers want free turning, snap turning (with or without scrolling) is annoying. Please add this as soon as possible devs. Also didn't know how to change options until I read other reviews, this needs to be more direct by pointing your finger at them. I'm stuck at the room with the circle on the door, tried drawing on it with chalk but nothing happens, devs please can you drop me a hint? Cheers

Edit: Guys thanks so much for getting back to me, it's nice to see devs actually reading the reviews and responding so fast :) However turning on comfort rotation on the options doesn't enable free turning, it has the opposite effect by instantly snapping the view instead of scrolling it. What I mean by free rotation is no snap turning at all, so you rotate like you would do in any non-VR game. Please can you implement this as a third movement option? You'll make me and a whole bunch of other gamers very happy.
review_feedback: Free turning has been added to the menu. The option is called "smooth rotation"

one_reviews_text:
Waited till Halloween night to finish this game , 
Its an experience with a little interaction , Good graphics , Creepy sound effects , Spooky atmosphere 
its  really scary and creepy. But its very short. 
Hope the follow up parts are releasing soon.

I had started the experience 4 times before i had the courage to continue till the end.

Recommended 100% But keep in mind that its very nice but also very short.

This is one of the most unique experience I have ever had in VR. It isnt your typical horror game and thats a good thing. From the very beginning you will find yourself thrown into a world that is beautifully crafted with great care and thoroughness. This isnt a game where you are just a spectator either. It is a game that requires you to think and it rewards the gamer for their efforts. I love how it forced me to really consider all the decisions that I needed to make. And honestly the level of detail that went into the writing and presentation of this game is something that is truly missing from a lot of VR games. I felt like a detective and the game allowed me to play like one. Every corner seems to be filled with new things to discover. The game mecahnics are top notch and as a VR developer I was blown away by how well the game mechanics have been implemented. There wasnt a moment where I felt lost and didnt know what to do. Everything is done so well and all of it feels natural and instictive. Plus it scared the crap out of me!! This is one of those games that you will not regret buying. It is a perfect blend of supernatural thriller and intellectual genius.
review_feedback: Thanks!

one_reviews_text: It's mostly beautiful to look at -- and certainly spooky -- but  many of the textures, such as a clock on the wall or chain on a door, are simply flat images on the background.  This broke immersion for me.  Also, it's over pretty quickly, and I  didn't understand the end.  I know it's Chapter 1, but I still would have liked to have understood exactly what happened.  Overall, I'm questioning whether it was worth $10.
review_feedback: Hey Aurans,  Did you find the other hidden path with another ending and more to discover in the cave?

review_title: Unplayable for me at the moment
one_reviews_text:
The game looks really good but I cant play it longer than five minuete because every 10 seconds the world around you is jumping up and down? I dont have this issue in any other game! It is also impossible to reach the settings in the main menue. I would write the devs but I cant find a support email adress! Waiting for an answer. If not I will refund it!

Edit: I found out by myself that you have to turn off head movement. Than it works fine for me. So now I was able to play the game. It is really nice! It seems a bit short, I couldnt save the game and I had some loading times.
review_feedback: Hey Novaliz, thanks for being the first to try out KOBOLD! Glad you found the remote control to deactivate head bob. Some people like it, some people hate it. If you have any other issues you can reach us at support@anotherworldvr.com. BTW there are two exits in the cave. One his obvious, one is hidden... in case you want to check it out again.

one_reviews_text:
It was April in Cannes, when I first experienced KOBOLD and it has only gotten better since then.  I was on a mission to see if anybody had figured out a way to tell a good story in VR and have it look good.  Most of what I tried was disappointing or even annoying.  Then I found KOBOLD.   Cinematic, photorealistic quality.  Immersive.  Engaging.  And bloody terrifying!

I consider this to be the golden standard now for how to mix narrative story and game.

Btw, everything worked fine on my Rift rig.  Didn't have to tweak a thing.

Finally! It is finished! Normal control on the oculus touch, as I expected. Without Fu....g teleports! The game is intense and interesting, I hope the full game will be released! Pretty scary, with good sound.

My issue is that there it literally no way to access a menu while playing. I have pressed every single button. Nothing. I am afraid to quit playing and my game isn't saved. I also would like to change some settings but there is no way to do so.
review_feedback: hey apstevens113, thanks for trying out KOBOLD! You can access the settings right at the beginning in the first room by picking up the remote control on the table (under the yellow desk lamp) and then hovering over the menu. You can then select your preferred settings. Hope this helps.

one_reviews_text: Ear-splitting sound glitch on skipping the intro, crashes on dropping the flashlight at the very start. Didn't go any further from there.
review_feedback: Hey, this is rare but sorry to read that it happened to you. We recently released an update that should fix the issue, which has to do with older sound drivers and their compatibiöity with the sound engine on some machines. let us know if it works for you now.

one_reviews_text: The headbobbing option i could not turned off but i still think its really solid expeirence.  Great graphics too.
review_feedback: Hey Natemo, thank you! When you are in the very first room at the beginning you can pick up a remote control and point it at the screen to your left with the settings to turn off headbob. You will find the remote lying under the yellow lamp on the computer desk.

one_reviews_text:
I bought this game based on the screenshots and it blew me away. 
It was super scary, the story got under my skin, there are so many hidden
things all over the house and it took me forever to muster up the courage to go up into the attic. I thought the controls were intuitive and I didnt have any problems at all. Definitely recommended! Looking forward to chapter II.

Saw this at the Festival du Nouveau Cinema and really loved it.  I bought it so I could go through the experience again as the creators have put in so much detail in to the work.  I recommend you take your time with this one, as there is lots to explore in the environment.  Can't wait for chapter 2!

I´m so happy to finally play this game. I have played this game some months ago on a festival in Berlin and it´s now even better. The atmosphere is soooo spooky. I really liked the part with the runes, because i have never seen a ridle and visualisation like this in any game. I hape to play the next chapter soon.
My Conclusion:
If you like VR, horror and a realistic environment, this game is just right for you.
